Spring/Summer 09 Trend Report

Resident Co-Style Director Davee Troublefield shares his take on what’s ahead for spring and summer.

Read more

Our resident Stylists, Michelle Lynch and Davee Troublefield, Share What’s in Their Closets and on Their Minds.

Spring/Summer 2009 – Trend Report by Davee Troublefield

In light of recent events with the economy, the spring and summer collections were filled with nods to the time of the Great Depression. 1929 was a tough year, and 2009 promises to deliver similar blows, but fashion stands up to face the rival! With inspiration from roaring 20’s flappers and apocalyptic Joans of Arc, designers prepare us for a brave new world.

Another trend we see heating up for summer is the ever classic, ever flattering Goddess Gown. Designers take the epic shape and create breezy, carefree versions for the approaching season. Metallic fabrics, liquid-like silks, and jewels make these reinventions worthy of Venus herself!

Next, we jet-set across the globe to arid desert environs. Designers took inspiration from Arabian textures and patterns, creating layered silhouettes that protect and shield from harsh environmental conditions. Scarves, head wraps, and military belts are as functional as they are stylish.


Designers keep coming back to the eighties, and this summer, the eighties are back in a BIG way! Ripped denim, shredded lace, studs, and leggings - all back, with a slightly more polished appearance. Never say never when it comes to big shoulder pads, though not the same pads we remember from Dynasty and Designing Women. Their new form evokes strength and shape rather than the hourglass shapes we think of in the excessive 80s.

Fitness seems to be the trend on and off the runway this spring and summer. Fashion is toning up with All-American athletic-inspired garments. Running pants, hoodies, and body suits hit the runways and inspires us to live healthy and lounge in comfort. Utilitarian as they may be, these pieces are much too pretty to sweat in...

More about our Resident Co-Stylists

Michelle Lynch


Michelle Lynch has been in the fashion and entertainment industry for 20 years, and has graced national magazines, runways and television during her stint in the industry. She currently produces fashion shows across the United States as well as scouts for talent.

As a celebrity stylist, Michelle has worked with high profile names like Usher, Lee Greenwood, Vanessa Williams, Joan Lunden, P. Diddy, Martha Stewart, Fantasia, Fergie, and Clinton Kelly of the ‘What Not To Wear’ Show.

Michelle’s latest grand venture was working as a stylist for the Inaugural Ball in January ’09. She was responsible for dressing those that attended the balls and dinners in Washington D.C. inducting President Obama.



Davee Troublefield


Davee Troublefield is an award winning Makeup Artist, Wardrobe Stylist and Creative Director, whose work has been featured in many media outlets, including Elle, New You and Woman’s Wear Daily. A forward thinker and serious fashionista, Davee has a unique style and southern charm; with his sights set on Global Beauty Domination, Davee and his team concept ideas to bring The Troublefield Lifestyle Brand to personal wardrobe styling, shopping, and organization. Davee delivers on everything one needs to look and feel chic.
